name: ComfyUI-Video-Stabilizer
readme_summary: The ComfyUI Video Stabilizer is a custom node for ComfyUI that stabilizes video footage using either classic feature point tracking or optical flow methods. It offers various framing modes to handle stabilization-induced edge artifacts, including cropping, padding, and expanding the canvas, with padding output as a mask for further processing like outpainting.
key_features: Video stabilization using classic feature points and Lucas-Kanade (LK) optical flow.
Video stabilization using DIS Optical Flow.
Framing modes: crop, crop_and_pad, and expand.
Padding output as a mask for outpainting.
Camera lock mode for tripod-like stabilization.
Output of stabilized video frames and metadata (JSON).
primary_use_case: Stabilizing video footage within ComfyUI workflows, particularly for AI-generated or manipulated video content, with options for handling edge artifacts and integration with outpainting tools.
cover_image_prompt: A seasoned cartographer meticulously stabilizing a shaky, hand-drawn map on a large drafting table. The map, representing raw video footage, is visibly blurred, but the cartographer's tools, glowing with digital energy, correct the distortions. The stabilized section of the map reveals crisp details. UI elements displaying video stabilization parameters float subtly in the background. The scene is set in a bright, organized studio with a warm, inviting atmosphere. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines, vibrant colors, and a focus on clarity.

name: Shiru
description: Manage your personal media library, organize your collection, and stream your content in real time, no waiting required!
readme_summary: Shiru is a personal media library manager that allows users to organize, track, and stream their legally owned media content in real time. It offers features like anime integration with AniList & MyAnimeList, full subtitle support, seamless video controls, and real-time library playback.
key_features: Full subtitle support (softcoded and external files)
Seamless video controls and keyboard shortcuts
primary_use_case: Managing and streaming personal media library.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a librarian meticulously organizing shelves filled with glowing film reels and anime scrolls. The librarian, wearing futuristic glasses displaying AniList data, carefully places each item. A beam of light projects from a reel, transforming into a streaming video on a nearby screen. Small UI elements float around, showing subtitle options and playback controls. The scene is set in a modern, minimalist library with soft, warm lighting. Digital particles represent data flowing between the shelves and the screen. The repository name, 'Shiru', is subtly etched on a bookshelf. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: kkTerminal
description: A terminal for Web SSH connection
readme_summary: kkTerminal is a web-based SSH client that allows users to access and manage remote servers through a terminal interface in their browser. It supports features like file management, customizable settings, and integration into third-party websites via iframe.
key_features: Adaptive window size and Chinese input
Preference settings (colors, font size, cursor style)
Shortcut key operations for file management
primary_use_case: Providing a web-based terminal interface for SSH connections to remote servers.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian stands in a grand library, connecting physical books (servers) to a digital interface (web browser) with glowing threads. The librarian uses a universal translator device to understand different languages (protocols). Small screens display file directories and code snippets. The library is filled with shelves representing different servers. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light. Digital particles flow between the books and the interface, symbolizing data transfer. The composition is centered and balanced with a focus on the librarian's activity. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: prom2grafana
description: Convert Prometheus metrics to Grafana dashboards and alert rules using AI

name: KubeForge
readme_summary: KubeForge is a visual editor for Kubernetes deployments that simplifies building, validating, and managing Kubernetes configurations. It provides an intuitive drag-and-drop interface with live schema references to streamline the creation of valid deployment YAML files, targeting both beginners and experienced users.
key_features: Smart schema awareness powered by Kubernetes JSON schemas
Modular component editor with support for templates and reusable specs
Real-time visual updates and dependency linking between resources
primary_use_case: Visually building, validating, and managing Kubernetes deployment configurations.
cover_image_prompt: A master architect overseeing a miniature city made of interconnected Kubernetes components. The architect uses a holographic interface to drag and drop services, adjust configurations, and link dependencies, causing the city to dynamically reconfigure. Small screens display YAML code snippets and schema validations. The scene is set in a bright, modern design studio with a blue and green color scheme. Digital particles flow between components, visualizing data flow. The KubeForge logo is subtly integrated into the holographic interface. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.
